result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Benjamin L. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: DNA Submission Form
for DEJ

1:50 pm - Court calls cases 16CF47, 16CM81 and 16CM82.  DA states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court orders Ct 1 on 16CM82 dismissed and amends Ct 2 to remove domestic abuse enhancer.  Court orders 16CF47 Ct 2 amended to 961.41(3g)(b), possession of controlled substance, an unclassified misdemeanor.    DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts except Ct 1 of 16CM82.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on the following, except Ct 1 in 16CF47 which court enters a deferred entry of judgment.  Comments by DE.  Court imposes:

16CF47 Ct 1 - 2 years deferred entry of judgment - see written order.  Bond to continue

Ct 2 - as amended
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
AODA and followthrough as appropriate
Obtain and maintain full time employment

16CM81 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
$65 SBDA
$801.54 restitution plus $80.15 surcharge for a total of $881.69
90 days jail with huber for work and treatment (stayed and to be used at the discretion of probation agent), cs to 16CM82
AODA and followthrough as appropriate
Obtain and maintain full time employment

16CM82 - as amended
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
$65 SBDA
30 days jail with huber for work and treatment, cs, to report by 1/1/18 at the discretion of probation agent
AODA and followthrough as appropriate
Obtain and maintain full time employment

Appeal rights given.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
of Preliminary Examination

11:06 am - DA calls cases 16CF47 and states appearances.  Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lex files a waiver of preliminary exam.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court accepts waiver.  Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.  To be set for arraignment.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2017 at 11:00 am.

11:04 am - DA calls cases 16CM81, 16CM82 and 16CF47 and states appearances. Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM81 and 82 are for motion hearing.  Parties stipulate to admissability of statements.  So ordered.  On 16CF47, officer Peterson is not here at this time.  DA requests adjournment due to this.  So ordered.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
State's - & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:37 am - Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex appearing telephonically.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 8/30/16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
